intro: Pygeum ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty African tamarind, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces pods containing flat, seed-rich pods that are used in traditional medicine. Its bark is often harvested for its medicinal properties, particularly in treating urinary disorders. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates.
